sentences.sContent: He spoke of the necessity for a reciprocal relationship that would be useful for all sides.
sentences.sCn: 他谈及需要建立对各方都有益的互惠关系。

sentences.sContent: Such treaties provide reciprocal rights and obligations.
sentences.sCn: 此类协议规定了相互之间的权利与义务。

synos.tran: [贸易]互惠的；相互的；[数]倒数的，彼此相反的

phrases.pCn: 相互转化；反向变换；倒数转换
互相酌；相互酌；交互作用

trans.tranCn: 互惠的；相互的；倒数的，彼此相反的
trans.tranOther: a reciprocal arrangement or relationship is one in which two people or groups do or give the same things to each other

trans.tranCn: [数] 倒数；互相起作用的事物
